info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Union County through 845 PM EDT... At 757 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Monroe, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Wesley Chapel, Mineral Springs, Indian Trail and Weddington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
